name: Introduction to Philosophy
description: This course introduces students to the general concepts of philosophy

name: History of Western Philosophy
description: This course examines the major historical figures and philosophical movements of Western Philosophy from the Ancient Greeks to the 20th century.

name: Philosophy of Religion
description: This course is an introduction to the philosophical study of religion. Topics may include the existence and nature of God, the relationship between faith and reason, the problem of evil, and the definition of religious language.

name: Existentialism
description: This course is an introduction to the philosophical movement known as existentialism. Topics may include the meaning of life, the nature of freedom, the role of human relationships, and the possibility of authentic existence.
